title: Positive vs Negative Commandments Quiz - Thou Shalt vs Thou Shalt Not
description: Can you tell the difference between a positive commandment ("thou shalt") and a negative commandment ("thou shalt not")? Test your knowledge of the 248 positive and 365 negative commandments.

questions.question: Is the commandment 'Know there is a G-d' a positive or negative commandment?
questions.explanation: Commandment #1 is a positive commandment instructing to acknowledge the existence of G-d, as stated in Exodus 20:2.

questions.question: Which book contains the commandment 'Do not make an idol for yourself'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #29 prohibits making an idol and is found in Exodus 20:4, categorizing it under Idolatry.

questions.question: How many negative commandments are there among the 613 mitzvot?
questions.explanation: There are 365 negative commandments corresponding to the days of the year, as part of the traditional enumeration of mitzvot.

questions.question: Which of the following is a positive commandment related to the Torah?
options: Do not listen to a false prophet
Do not destroy objects associated with G-d's Name
Do not hate fellow covenant members
questions.explanation: Commandment #22 is a positive commandment instructing to learn and teach the Torah, as found in Deuteronomy 6:7.

questions.question: Does the commandment 'Do not eat meat of an animal that was mortally wounded' belong to positive or negative commandments?
questions.explanation: Commandment #190 prohibits eating meat from a mortally wounded animal, making it a negative commandment from Exodus 22:31.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Bless the Almighty after eating' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #85 requires blessing G-d after eating, a positive commandment from Deuteronomy 8:10.

questions.question: What category does the commandment 'The priests must bless the Israelite nation daily' fall under?
questions.explanation: Commandment #78 instructs priests to bless Israel daily, categorized under Levites & Priests in Numbers 6:23.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The traditional enumeration of the 613 commandments includes 248 positive commandments which correspond to ________.
questions.explanation: The 248 positive commandments correspond to the 248 bones in the human body according to tradition.

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits 'Women must not wear men's clothing'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #71 forbids cross-dressing, found in Deuteronomy 22:5 under Personal Appearance.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not listen to a false prophet' is positive.
questions.explanation: Commandment #43 forbids listening to false prophets, making it a negative commandment from Deuteronomy 13:4.

questions.question: In which category is the commandment 'Rest on the eighth day of the Feast of Tabernacles' classified?
questions.explanation: Commandment #106 is a positive commandment related to the holiday observance under Appointed Times in Leviticus 23:36.

questions.question: How many positive commandments are there among the 613 mitzvot?
questions.explanation: There are 248 positive commandments corresponding traditionally to the number of human bones.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not curse your father and mother' is negative.
questions.explanation: Commandment #582 forbids cursing parents, a negative commandment from Exodus 21:17.

questions.question: Which commandment requires 'The court must send the accidental murderer to a city of refuge'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #484 is a positive commandment on judicial procedure found in Numbers 35:25.

questions.question: Identify the type of commandment: 'Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer'.
questions.explanation: Commandment #197 forbids eating bread from new grain before the Omer, a negative commandment from Leviticus 23:14.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: There are 365 negative commandments in the 613 mitzvot, which traditionally correspond to the number of ________.
questions.explanation: The 365 negative commandments correspond to the days of the solar year.

questions.question: Which book contains the commandment 'The high priest must not marry a widow'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #169 is negative, found in Leviticus 21:14 concerning priestly restrictions.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Appoint judges' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #540 commands appointing judges, a positive mitzvah from Deuteronomy 16:18.

questions.question: Which of the following commandments is classified under the category 'Food' and is positive?
options: Examine the signs of animals to distinguish kosher
Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
Do not eat meat of an animal that was mortally wounded
Do not eat bread from new grain before the Omer
questions.correctAnswer: Examine the signs of animals to distinguish kosher
questions.explanation: Commandment #176 is a positive commandment instructing to examine kosher signs, found in Leviticus 11:2.

questions.question: What is the nature of the commandment 'Do not desire another's possession'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #477 forbids coveting, a negative commandment from Deuteronomy 5:18.

questions.question: True or False: The book of Leviticus contains more negative commandments than positive commandments according to the data provided.
questions.explanation: Leviticus features many prohibitive laws such as #15, #141, #183, indicating a predominance of negative commandments.

questions.question: Which commandment requires 'The high priest must bring a meal offering every day'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #379 is a positive commandment about daily priestly offerings in Leviticus 6:20.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids contacting the dead?
options: Do not attempt to contact the dead
Do not eat non-kosher flying insects
Do not curse the head of state
questions.correctAnswer: Do not attempt to contact the dead
questions.explanation: Commandment #64 forbids necromancy, a negative commandment from Deuteronomy 18:11.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Destroy the seven Canaanite nations' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #596 is a positive commandment commanding destruction of Canaanite nations, from Deuteronomy 20:17.

questions.question: Which category includes the commandment 'The Levite must set aside a tenth of his tithe for the priest'?
questions.explanation: Commandment #253 is a positive commandment about tithes in Numbers 18:26 under Terumah and Tithes.
